page.title: 16Babysitting Circles
page.content: Wombourne is a growing village popular with young families. Having to pay a babysitter can be a drain on income so several babysitting circles have been formed. There are sixteen families in the circle to which I belong. Payment is made using cardboard tokens-one per hour before midnight and double rates after. Usually "Mums" do the sitting but this is not always the case. On moving to Wombourne I knew no-one so joining the circle was an excellent way to get to know people as the Mums and Dads meet socially once a month on different evenings: the mums taking it in turn to host a pot-luck supper, the dads preferring to meet for a drink at the pub. The mums and dads do sometimes meet together socially---if they can all get babysitters!
